Description: Ostracon, fragment of a red pottery wheel-made bowl with foot-ring, flaring sides and everted ledge-rim, the fabric is pock-marked and grey in section, with very faint traces of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, and containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.93)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87597) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87597)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 99 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
